full_summary:
### RCMP "E" Division Gold River Furniture RFP

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) seeks to procure furniture for its Gold River, BC location.  

#### Tender Details

- **Reference Number**: CB-596-1226623
- **Solicitation Number**: M2989-3-0271
- **Publication Date**: October 23, 2023
- **Tender Closing Date**: November 7, 2023, at 5:00 PM (PST)
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: November 20, 2023
- **Expected Contract End Date**: February 28, 2024

#### Description of Requirement

The RCMP has a requirement to purchase, deliver, and install office furniture to Gold River, BC. The deadline for delivery is February 28, 2024.

#### Solicitation Information

- **Solicitation Type**: Request for Proposals (RFP)
- **Procurement Category**: Goods and Services (GD)
- **Trade Agreements**: Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA) and Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
- **Regions of Opportunity**: Canada
- **Regions of Delivery**: British Columbia

#### Evaluation Criteria

Bids will be evaluated based on their compliance with the requirements outlined in the solicitation and their proposed price. The lowest-priced compliant bid will be recommended for award.

#### Submission Requirements

Tenders must be submitted to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit, in English or French, to:

Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP)
Procurement & Contracting Services
Luba.vinnitsky@rcmp-grc.gc.ca
Mailstop 909, 14200 Green Timbers Way
Surrey, BC V3T 6P3

#### Contact Information

- **Contracting Authority**: Luba Vinnitsky
- **Email**: Luba.vinnitsky@rcmp-grc.gc.ca
- **Phone**: (778) 290-3013

#### Notice of Request for Quotation (NRQ)

This solicitation is in response to a Request for Proposal (RFP). The solicitation is open to all qualified suppliers. The RCMP retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

#### Indigenous Procurement

The RCMP encourages Indigenous suppliers to participate in this solicitation. The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is an online resource for all levels of government and the private sector to identify Indigenous business capacity.
